intro: Randia stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Randia stenantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
